@Adam Topaz The mono assumption there ensures that pullback behaves like an intersection.
This allows me to deduce D.t i j ≫ D.t j i = 𝟙 _ and D.t' i j k ≫ (pullback_symmetry _ _).hom ≫ D.t' j i k ≫ (pullback_symmetry _ _).hom = 𝟙 _ from the arguments given. Replacing the mono assumption with these two equations probably will work as well, but I don't think this is worth it.

Actually, I don't really think this glue data stuff would be used except for gluing sheaves / schemes this way. For other descent constructions afterwards, we will be working with a covering family, and we would know where our structures are descending to. I think this would need another interface, and I do not have any sensible way at mind to unify these constructions.
cc @Adam Topaz @Reid Barton
